tagline: 3D Model of Andrea Palladio's Villa Foscari
body:
![Villa Foscari](http://www.google.it/url?source=imglanding&ct=img&q=http://www.robertomarini.net/gallery/d/949-2/Villa+Foscari+_La+Malcontenta_+12.jpg&sa=X&ei=-u4GUPvyBInl4QS88tnJCQ&ved=0CAkQ8wc&usg=AFQjCNELQDU23XeYndBMLCTjh20dBnljYg)

### Introduction
Villa Foscari is a Patrician Villa in Mira, near Venice, northern Italy, designed by the Italian architect Andrea Palladio.  
It is also known as La Malcontenta, a nickname which it received when the spouse of one of the Foscaris was locked up in the house because she allegedly didn't live up to her conjugal duty.

More informations and tips can be found at:
1. [Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Villa_Foscari)
2. [Main-Page](http://www.lamalcontenta.com/) 

### Hierarchical decomposition of the model
During to approach to the creation of three-dimensional model, we chose to hierarchically decompose the structure of the villa into five-plus-one contexts:
* **The Basement:** _The Twin Stairs, the Colonnade-Basement and the Garden_
* **The Main Building**
* **The Colonnade** _(precisely, A column)_
* **The Front Facade of the Villa:** _The Main Roof and the Tympanum_
* **The Back-Side of the Villa:** _Circular Glass and Back Facade_
* **All the other stuff:** _windows, banisters, gratings and chimneyspot_

_Please note:_ the code has been implemented with `export` functions, which means each of such contexts it's independent from others and can be drawn singularly.
![Export Function](http://imageshack.us/a/img96/3729/schermata092456190alle1.png)

### Twin Stairs and Colonnade-Basement

Due its symmetrical nature, Villa Foscari can be split in a right-half and a left-half.

If we focus on the last one, we'll obtain the other half simply with a `S` trasformation.
Moreover, Rotational trasformations, `R`, are used to create the upper side of the stairs and due its squareness, we'll use mostly `CUBOID` functions.
![Twin Stairs](http://imageshack.us/a/img7/3729/schermata092456190alle1.png)

The same trick can be used to draw the Colonnade_Basement, which is exactly between the twin stairs.

![Colonnade Basement](http://imageshack.us/a/img94/3729/schermata092456190alle1.png)

Here you can see the final result, combining the stairs and the basement.

![Final Result](http://imageshack.us/a/img839/3729/schermata092456190alle1.png)
### Main Building
Please notice that every window, before being applied to the model, passes through a `BOUNDARY` function for aesthetic purpose.
![Main Building](http://imageshack.us/a/img801/3729/schermata092456190alle1.png)

### The Colonnade
The colonnade is the most complex part of the project as it was decided to model the capital as an Archimedean spiral drawn by a `NUBS` (Archimedean spiral). It was also used a light-domain to avoid overloading the global model.

To draw the column instead, we chose to adopt divide-and-conquer-approach:
* _Column-Base_ with `NUBS` and `ROTATIONAL SURFACE`.
* _Column-Shaft_ with a `CYLINDER_SURFACE`
* _Column-Capital_ still with `NUBS` `ROTATIONAL SURFACE` and `BEZIER`
![Column](http://desmond.imageshack.us/Himg805/scaled.php?server=805&filename=schermata072456127alle2.png&res=landing)

The entire Colonnade, which is basically a column replicated and then translated through the function `REPLICA`, counts ten columns advisably placed upon the Colonnade Basement.

![Colonnade](http://desmond.imageshack.us/Himg507/scaled.php?server=507&filename=schermata072456127alle2.png&res=landing)

### The Main Roof and Tympanum
The tympanum has been modeled with `CUBOID` roto-traslated.
The Main Roof counts a `SCALE` colonnade-roof, combined with 2*`CUBOID` and 2*`TRIANGLE_DOMAIN` advisably rotated and translated.

![Main Roof](http://imageshack.us/a/img803/3729/schermata092456190alle1.png)

### All together: The Front Facade
Here you can have a view of all the previous contexts mixed together, forming the Main Facade:
![The FrontFacade](http://imageshack.us/a/img534/1631/schermata20120925alle09.png)


### The Backside of the Villa

With its circular glass, along with its asymmetrical facade, the back-side of the villa is one of the most complex part of the model.
The glass just above the circular one, has been modeled by a `2D DOMAIN` and a `TRIANGLE_DOMAIN`.

![The Backside](http://imageshack.us/a/img253/1631/schermata20120925alle09.png)

### Last but not least: All the other stuff

At the end of our rendering process we did take care of details, such as:

*  **_Gratings_**  
![Gratings](http://desmond.imageshack.us/Himg585/scaled.php?server=585&filename=schermata072456127alle2.png&res=landing)

*  **_Banisters_** 
![Banisters](http://desmond.imageshack.us/Himg69/scaled.php?server=69&filename=schermata072456127alle2.png&res=landing)

*  **_Windows and Shutters_** 
![Window](http://desmond.imageshack.us/Himg594/scaled.php?server=594&filename=schermata072456127alle2.png&res=landing)

* **_Chimneys-pot upon the Main roof_**
![Chimneypots](http://imageshack.us/a/img545/3729/schermata092456190alle1.png)

### Final View
The complete model, as a result of the union of each hierarchical level, is as follows:
![All](http://imageshack.us/a/img267/8657/4ac84247243c4d8aae6fdd1.jpg)
